sections.name: Caligni Assassin
Shadowfade
sections.text:
Caligni assassins gain their power from an infusion of planar essence directly from the Netherworld, which the owb help them develop into powerful abilities. This comes at a cost: all caligni assassins eventually succumb to an affliction known as shadowfade. This magical malady causes the caligni's body to painfully warp when concealed in shadows, as the plane's ability to create twisted reflections of reality changes their physical form directly.  
  
 Sometimes a caligni assassin will flee home and strike out on their own to avoid becoming a twisted tool for their greedy leaders. Such freelancers are in high demand for those seeking a fatal solution to their own political problems.

sources.name: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm

link.name: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm pg. 85
link.alt: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm pg. 85

sections.text:
Calignis often get stereotyped as murderers, but the title of assassin is one of the rarest in their society. Caligni settlements go decades without having offspring born with enough potential. However, once a child shows they have “the gift,” the settlements leaders might give the babe to the owb, who mold and shape the child into an instrument of shadows and death.  
  
 Lauded and shunned, caligni assassins often become unwitting pawns in clashes between caligni settlements or between rival factions of caligni society.

sources.name: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm

link.name: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm pg. 85
link.alt: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm pg. 85

sections.name: Caligni
Caligni Faiths
sections.text: Some calignis have abandoned their traditional faith in favor of more active deities; evil individuals favor Norgorber or Zon-Kuthon, while the less malevolent might follow Nocticula or Pharasma. Perhaps unexpectedly, Desna also has a small caligni following, particularly among those who frequently travel.

sections.name: Caligni Treasure
sections.text: Many calignis hide shiny baubles and trinkets beneath their dark rags, keeping them out of sight of their greedy kin. They also keep several doses of black smear poison on hand to incapacitate foes.

sections.name: The Caligni Legacy
sections.text: The calignis are descendants of humans who, millennia ago, fled underground to escape a devastating cataclysm and begged malevolent, shadowy demigods known only as the Forsaken for salvation. The Forsaken warped the refugees into tough survivors, but at a price: every caligni that dies combusts in a burst of energy that provides a scrap of soul energy to the Forsaken. The greatest irony of the caligni's bargain is that the Forsaken themselves mysteriously vanished long ago and no longer answer pleas or prayers. Today, caligni still burst into light upon death, but their soul energy no longer feeds a mysterious pantheon of shadowy divinities.

Calignis lurk in subterranean cities, creeping to the surface to steal, stalk, or make mischief. Each caligni serves in a specific role and grows into a specific form as determined by supernatural traditions and influences in caligni society. Regardless of their size or role, all calignis are gaunt, with pale flesh and white eyes. Some surface dwellers call the caligni “dark folk,” a term they dislike because it doesn’t reflect either their appearance or character, only their environment.  
  
Each individual in caligni society serves a specific role. At times, certain roles so rarely find suitable candidates that a community might only see a few individuals fill them in an entire generation.

sources.name: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm

link.name: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm pg. 85
link.alt: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm pg. 85

traits.name: Rare
traits.text: This rarity indicates that a rules element is very difficult to find in the game world. A rare feat, spell, item or the like is available to players only if the GM decides to include it in the game, typically through discovery during play. Creatures with this trait are rare. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creatures is increased by 5.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Medium
traits.text: *Space:* 5 feet, *Reach (Tall):* 5 feet, *Reach (Long):* 5 feet

traits.name: Caligni
traits.text: These subterranean people have darkvision, and some have powers to create darkness.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

traits.name: Shadow
traits.text:
Magic with this trait involves shadows or the energy of the Netherworld.  
  
 Planes with this trait are umbral with murky light. In the Netherworld, the radius of all light from light sources and the areas of light spells are halved.

sources.name: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm

link.name: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm pg. 85
link.alt: Pathfinder #194: Cult of the Cave Worm pg. 85

interaction_abilities.name: Shadow Shift
interaction_abilities.text: Caligni assassins are concealed in dim light or darkness even to creatures that can see clearly in those light levels.

interaction_abilities.name: Swift Sneak
interaction_abilities.text: The assassin can move their full speed while Sneaking.

automatic_abilities.name: Countershadow
automatic_abilities.trigger: A creature within 60 feet casts a light spell
automatic_abilities.effect: The caligni assassin attempts to counteract the triggering spell. Caligni assassins automatically recognize light spells.

traits.name: Darkness
traits.text: Darkness effects extinguish non-magical light in the area and can counteract less powerful magical light. You must usually target light magic with your darkness magic directly to counteract it, but some darkness spells automatically attempt to counteract light.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text:
This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to occult magic.

automatic_abilities.name: Death Umbral Shroud

traits.name: Darkness
traits.text: Darkness effects extinguish non-magical light in the area and can counteract less powerful magical light. You must usually target light magic with your darkness magic directly to counteract it, but some darkness spells automatically attempt to counteract light.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text:
This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to occult magic.

automatic_abilities.text: When a caligni assassin dies, their body disintegrates into a veil of supernatural darkness for 1 round. A 4th-level darkness spell appears, centered on the assassin's location, with a counteract DC of 23.

automatic_abilities.name: Deny Advantage
automatic_abilities.text: The assassin isn't flat-footed to creatures of 8th level or lower that are hidden, undetected, flanking, or using surprise attack.

universal_monster_ability.name: Light Blindness
universal_monster_ability.text: When first exposed to bright light, the monster is blinded until the end of its next turn. After this exposure, light doesn't blind the monster again until after it spends 1 hour in darkness. However, as long as the monster is in an area of bright light, it's dazzled.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Versatile
traits.text: A versatile weapon can be used to deal a different type of damage than its listed type. This trait indicates the alternate damage type. For instance, a piercing weapon with versatile S can deal piercing or slashing damage. You choose the damage type each time you attack.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

traits.name: Thrown
traits.text: You can throw this weapon as a ranged attack; it is a ranged weapon when thrown. You add your Strength modifier to damage as you would for a melee weapon. When this trait appears on a melee weapon, it also includes the range increment. Ranged weapons with this trait use the range increment in the weapon’s Range entry.

ability.name: Shadow Leap

traits.name: Darkness
traits.text: Darkness effects extinguish non-magical light in the area and can counteract less powerful magical light. You must usually target light magic with your darkness magic directly to counteract it, but some darkness spells automatically attempt to counteract light.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text:
This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to occult magic.

traits.name: Teleportation
traits.text: Teleportation effects instantaneously move something from one point in space to another. Teleportation does not usually trigger reactions based on movement.

ability.requirement: The assassin is in dim light or darkness
ability.effect: The assassin vanishes into shadow, appearing in a square of dim light or darkness within 60 feet. If the assassin appears adjacent to a creature, they can Strike that creature, otherwise the assassin can Hide.

ability.name: Sneak Attack
ability.text: The assassin deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

universal_monster_ability.name: Sneak Attack
universal_monster_ability.text: When the monster Strikes a creature that has the flat-footed condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

ability.name: Umbral Veil

traits.name: Darkness
traits.text: Darkness effects extinguish non-magical light in the area and can counteract less powerful magical light. You must usually target light magic with your darkness magic directly to counteract it, but some darkness spells automatically attempt to counteract light.

ability.requirement: The assassin's last action was a successful melee Strike
ability.effect: The assassin extends a tendril of shadow to obscure the target's vision, blinding them for 1 round (DC 23 Will negates). On a critical failure, they're blind for 1 minute. Creatures with greater darkvision are immune to this ability.
